intro: Schismus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy schismus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Chenopodiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its succulent, hairy leaves and small, greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Schismus hirsutus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
